Specific Details: MS Ireland contacted Deputy Mark Ward in relation to the temporary suspension of Primary Medical Certificates as people living with MS were unable to obtain these certificates.

Subject Matter: MS Ireland contacted Deputy Mark Ward in relation to the temporary suspension of Primary Medical Certificates as people living with MS were unable to obtain these certificates.

Lobbying Activities:

We asked Deputy Ward to raise this issue. 

We followed up by email a second time, to thank Deputy Ward for his support on the issue.|Email|2-5

Specific Details: MS Ireland contacted a TD to raise a PQ on our behalf regarding the Disabled Drivers Medical Board of Appeals. We were made aware that the Board was non-operational which resulted in people living with MS and other conditions not having a mechanism by which to appeal decisions made regarding their application to the Disabled Drivers and Passengers Scheme.
Subject Matter: MS Ireland contacted a TD to raise a PQ on our behalf regarding the Disabled Drivers Medical Board of Appeals. We were made aware that the Board was non-operational which resulted in people living with MS and other conditions not having a mechanism by which to appeal decisions made regarding their application to the Disabled Drivers and Passengers Scheme.
Intended Results: We intended to have a PQ raised in order to confirm when we could expect this Board to resume.
Lobbying Activities: MS Ireland contacted Deputy Ward regarding the issue of the resignation of the Disabled Drivers Medical Board of Appeal members, to understand when this Board might be reinstated and appeals may be processed.|Phone call|1::MS Ireland sent a follow-up email to Deputy Ward with further information regarding the issue we raised. https://www.rte.ie/news/ireland/2022/0111/1272941-disabled-drivers-medical-board-of-appeal/|Email|1

Lobbyist Name: StartBright Early Learning Centres Company CLG
Specific Details: A petition had been made to support Road Safety in Deansrath, Clondalkin to increase Road Safety for service users and community members in Saint Cuthbert’s Road, Deansrath, Clondalkin Dublin D22
DPOs Lobbied: Francis Timmons|Councillor|South Dublin County Council::Mark Ward|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas
Subject Matter: A petition had been made to support Road Safety in Deansrath, Clondalkin to increase Road Safety for service users and community members in Saint Cuthbert’s Road, Deansrath, Clondalkin Dublin D22
Intended Results: Pedestrian crossing or alternative solution for safe crossing of Saint Cuthbert’s Road between two Early Childhood and School Aged Childcare Services. There is also local shops, community centre and family resource centre services who's users will benefit from a pedestrian crossing. The increased footfall to this area upon the extension of Afterschool services to 6pm will also ensure safe crossing in darker winter months for children and their families.
Lobbying Activities:
1.	Petition registered on change.org to support establishing the pedestrian crossing and shared with the local services and shared via email to TD and Councillor to share for support locally
|Email|6-10::Petition registered on change.org and shared on social media and website platforms|Social Media|2-5
Grassroots directive: A petition was raised in response to supporting Road Safety in Deansrath, Clondalkin to increase Road Safety for service users and community members in Saint Cuthbert’s Road, Deansrath, Clondalkin Dublin D22. We sent out petition, lobbied local TD's and councillors to share petition.

Specific Details: CEO Sarah Jane Hennelly submitted 4 parliamentary questions through the office of Deputy Mark Ward Sinn Fein TD for Dublin Mid-West
DPOs Lobbied: Mark Ward|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas::Stephen Donnelly|Minister|Department of Health::Stephen Donnelly|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas
Subject Matter: CEO Sarah Jane Hennelly submitted 4 parliamentary questions through the office of Deputy Mark Ward Sinn Fein TD for Dublin Mid-West
Intended Results: To understand the waiting lists, number of clients seen and sessions delivered, and amount of funding granted to Counselling In Primary Care in 2023.
Lobbying Activities:
We submitted the following 4 PQs:
To ask the Minister for Health:
the no of people waiting for an appointment with CIPC, by CHO area & by time waiting in tabular form; & to make a statement on the matter; the no. of people who received counselling from CIPC since 2019; the no. of counselling sessions delivered by CIPC since 2019; the cost of delivering CIPC since 2019; the average cost of a session inclusive of staffing and administration costs; the funding allocated to CIPC per year|Email|1

Lobbyist Name: Irish Association for Counselling and Psychotherapy - IACP
Specific Details: Urged political parties and government officials to prioritise mental health funding and programmes in their election manifestos and in the new government.
Subject Matter: Urged political parties and government officials to prioritise mental health funding and programmes in their election manifestos and in the new government.
Intended Results:
The application of a VAT exemption to counsellors and psychotherapists in line with the exemption currently available to psychologists and other health professionals. 

To expand tax relief for counselling and psychotherapy services to be deemed an eligible expense in line with other health expenses.

For the School Counselling Pilot to be made permanent and extended to all primary and secondary schools in the country.
Lobbying Activities: Requested a meeting to discuss our Pre-Budget Submission priorities, listed above. |Letter|1
